title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Hambantota district, today (28), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Myanmar junta stages election after five years of civil war
byline: Voting began Sunday (Dec 28) in Myanmar’s heavily restricted polls, with the ruling junta touting the exercise as a return to democracy five years after it ousted the last elected government, triggering civil war.

title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
byline: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect along the border, where almost three weeks of deadly clashes have forced nearly one million people from their homes.

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ Audio Launch: Vijay gets emotional at his final film-related event
byline: The grand audio launch of Vijay’s upcoming film Jana Nayagan will be held at the National Stadium Bukit Jalil in Malaysia today.

title: Suspect arrested with foreign-made firearm and T-56 ammunition in Minuwangoda
byline: A suspect has been arrested by police in the Minuwangoda area while in possession of a foreign-made firearm, a magazine, and 25 rounds of T-56 ammunition.

title: Sri Lanka’s 2026 holiday calendar: Here’s the full list
byline: With just three days remaining until the start of 2026, the Government Printing Department has released the official calendar for the upcoming year, which includes 26 public holidays.

title: 57-year-old killed following dispute with neighbour
byline: A person has been assaulted and killed in the Samarugama area of Ayagama, according to police.

title: 28-year-old dies in trap gun accident in Medawachchiya
byline: A 28-year-old man has died after a trap gun accidentally fired in a cultivation land in the Udumbugalawatta area of Medawachchiya, police said.

title: Kotiyagala Estate workers donate one-day salary to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: A group of estate workers have donated their one-day salary to the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund.

title: Legendary singer Latha Walpola’s final rites on Wednesday
byline: The interment of legendary Sri Lankan singer Latha Walpola will be performed at the Borella General Cemetery on 31 December, 2025 (Wednesday) following the paying of final respects at Independence Square, family sources confirmed.

title: Magnitude 5.8 earthquake strikes near coast of northern Peru, GFZ says
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 5.8 struck near the coast of northern Peru on Saturday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

title: State of emergency declared in New York as US storm disrupts at least 1,500 flights
byline: A powerful winter storm has disrupted one of the busiest travel weekends of the year in New York City and northeastern US.

title: SMEs seek extension of deadline for disaster-affected industries registration
byline: The Small and Medium-Scale Enterprises (SMEs) Association have requested the government to extend the December 16, 2025 deadline for registering industries affected by the recent disaster to January 16, 2026.

title: 840 suspects arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 840 suspects have been arrested during island-wide raids conducted yesterday (27) under the “Nation United - National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Investigations launched into additional firearms issued to ex-Minister Douglas Devananda
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into additional firearms issued by the Sri Lanka Army to former Minister Douglas Devananda, who is currently in custody.

title: TUs demand meaningful discussions before extending school hours
byline: If there is a genuine intention to achieve successful outcomes through the implementation of education reforms, it is essential to hold comprehensive and meaningful discussions with school principals and teachers and to act in a flexible manner, stated Nimal Mudunkotuwa, the General Secretary of the Graded Principals’ Association.

title: Ex-Minister Douglas Devananda remanded
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Friday (26), has been remanded until January 9, 2026.

title: French cinema legend Brigitte Bardot dies at 91
byline: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, her foundation said Sunday.

title: Tamil Nadu steps up surveillance after bird flu cases reported in Kerala
byline: The Tamil Nadu Public Health Department has ordered increased surveillance and preventive measures in districts bordering Kerala following the detection of avian influenza (H1N1) in the neighbouring state, reported the IANS.

title: Police begin probe after hoax bomb threat at Bandaranaike Airport
byline: An aircraft that arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport was subjected to a special security inspection following a false report claiming that several suspicious individuals were on board.

title: Amazon halts plans for drone delivery in Italy
byline: Amazon said on Sunday it has decided not to pursue plans to deliver goods by drone in Italy, saying that while it had made good progress with aerospace regulators, broader business regulatory issues did not support the project.

title: Software Engineer among eight arrested for smuggling cannabis from Odisha to Sri Lanka
byline: A Software Engineer is among eight persons who have been arrested in India’s Andhra Pradesh for allegedly supplying cannabis from Narsipatnam to Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka.

title: State of Public Emergency in Sri Lanka extended
byline: The State of Public Emergency in Sri Lanka has been extended.

title: President declares electricity, fuel supply, ports and aviation as essential services
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued an extraordinary gazette notification declaring a number of services, including the supply of electricity, as essential services.

title: Bangladesh police say student leader’s killers fled to India
byline: Bangladesh police on Sunday (Dec 28) said the alleged killers of popular student leader Sharif Osman Hadi had fled to India, in comments likely to further strain relations with its neighbour.

title: Train services between Colombo and Chilaw to resume tomorrow
byline: Train services between Colombo Fort and Chilaw on the Puttalam railway line will resume from tomorrow (29), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: UK restricts DR Congo visas over migrant return policy
byline: The UK is to impose visa restrictions against people arriving from the Democratic Republic of Congo after its government failed to agree to measures allowing the return of illegal migrants and foreign national offenders.

title: Constable linked to incident involving NPP MP seeks police protection
byline: The Police Constable who was arrested in connection with an alleged assault incident involving Ratnapura District National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Shantha Pathma Kumara Subasingha, has sought police protection.

title: Two Indian nationals arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle smartphones and cigarettes
byline: Two foreign nationals who attempted to smuggle a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes and smartphones into the country have been arrested by the Airport Customs officers.

title: Veteran singer Latha Walpola’s funeral arrangements announced
byline: The government has decided to conduct the final rites of veteran singer Latha Walpola with full state honours.

title: Nine arrested in Italy for allegedly raising millions for Hamas
byline: Italian police have arrested nine people accused of raising around €7m (£6m) for Hamas over more than two years.
